results.title: The Ladies man
results.creator_credit: York Pictures, Paramount Pictures and Jerry Lewis
results.brief_description: This comedy starring Jerry Lewis (his third directorial effort) is set in an all female boarding house, brimming with sex-starved women. Lewis plays Herbert H. Herbert, a university graduate sworn off love whilst mourning the break-up of a relationship, who takes a job as house boy. As well as being in charge of repairs, the fumbling Herbert has to deal with being the lone male presence amid so many nubile beauties. The house itself, a multilayered set built at enormous cost, is an impressive and colourful piece that at times dwarfs the star and the patchy narrative. Typically, several musical interludes pepper the action, allowing for some imaginative moments of dance and song. Characteristically for a Lewis comedy, the talented comedian is given free reign to display his brand of silly, goofy and slapstick physical humour, highlighting his penchant for physical idiocy and facial expressiveness. Cast includes Helen Traubel, Kathleen Freeman, Hope Holiday, Mary Laroche and Madlyn Rhue.

results.title: The Ladies' man; Lord Byron lived here; The Lift
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Hancock’s half hour”.
Three episodes from the British television comedy series “Hancock” starring Tony Hancock. 1. The Ladies man: Hancock decides to take things into his own hands and improve his success rate with the opposite sex. 2. Lord Byron lives here: The discovery of scribblings by the great poet Byron leads Hancock to open his house as a stately home, exploit the American tourists and make a fortune at the same time. The Lift: What a captive audience has top put up with when Hancock tips the balance of one too many in the lift and the lift won’t budge.

results.title: The Lacemaker = La Dentelliere
results.creator_credit: Action Films, Filmproduktion Janus, Citel Films, Yves Peyrot, Yves Gasser and Claude Goretta
results.brief_description: Pomme works as a hairdresser and lives with her protective mother in Paris. She goes on a holiday to the seaside town of Cabourg with a more worldly friend. There she forms a relationship with Francois, a young student, and they decide to live together in Paris. Social differences soon emerge. While Francois is garrulously intellectual, Pomme is reserved, incapable of communicating with Francois and his friends but maintaining a mysterious inner radiance. Goretta has described his film as “a genre painting” in narrative form and it is constructed in a series of brief fragmentary scenes which form a picture without evident narrative connections. With its narrative ellipses - eloquent silences and observation of Pomme’s mysterious inner life - Goretta’s film resembles Bresson’s “Une Femme Douce”. Cast includes Isabelle Huppert, Yves Benneyton, Florence Giorgetti, and Anne-Marie Duringer. Based on the novel by Pascal Laine. In French with English subtitles.

results.title: The Kulu valley
results.creator_credit: Chris McCullough and Australian Broadcasting Corporation
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Journey into India”.
Keith Adam takes viewers on a trek through the Kulu Valley in the middle of the Himalayan Mountain Range, a fertile strip of flat land between high snow-capped mountains.

results.title: The Kremlin
results.brief_description: A guided tour of the Kremlin recreating events in Russian history associated with the building from the 12th century up until its present day role as a museum and seat of the Social Government. Shows the great halls, paintings, ikons and treasures which belonged to the Czars.

results.title: The Krays
results.creator_credit: Fugitive Features, Dominic Anciano, Ray Burdis and Peter Medak
results.brief_description: Growing up in the East End of London during World War 2, the Kray twins became the heads of London’s gangster underworld in the 1960’s. After their release from prison during their teens, the Krays consolidated their underworld connections and “The Firm” was born. Ruling through fear, extortion and violence, the Kray’s empire dominated the crime world for years. Finally in 1969, they were convicted of murder and separated in prison. At their beloved mother’s death in 1982, they were briefly reunited before returning to prison. A compelling film biography.

results.title: The Koorie Oral History Program and the Bill Onus family archive
results.brief_description: Koorie people record ourselves as a means of self-representation, to destroy stereotypes and to ensure that we are not erased. These films from the Koori Oral History Program and the Bill Onus family archive preserve our culture and kinship for future generations.

constellations_primary.name: Connecting through film
constellations_primary.description: Film acts like a time capsule to our collective past. Capturing our most treasured moments with family has never been more accessible, with technology right at our fingers.

results.title_for_label: The Koorie Oral History Program and the Bill Onus family archive
results.description:
Koorie people record ourselves as a means of self-representation, to destroy stereotypes and to ensure that we are not erased. These films from the Koorie Oral History Program and the Bill Onus family archive preserve our culture and kinship for future generations.

“When we talk about Traditional Aboriginal knowledge in Victoria we need to remember it is one of the oldest living forms of communication in the world. It continues today as one of the main mediums through which cultural knowledge and story lines are passed on. The images you will see in this exhibition reflect the value and importance of oral knowledge as an ongoing and vibrant cultural link with the past.” - Dr Wayne Atkinson senior Yorta Yorta Elder and creator of the Koorie Oral History Program
description_for_label:
Koorie people record ourselves as a means of self-representation, to destroy stereotypes and to ensure that we are not erased. These films from the Koorie Oral History Program and the Bill Onus family archive preserve our culture and kinship for future generations.

It continues today as one of the main mediums through which cultural knowledge and story lines are passed on. The images you will see in this exhibition reflect the value and importance of oral knowledge as an ongoing and vibrant cultural link with the past.” - Dr Wayne Atkinson senior Yorta Yorta Elder and creator of the Koorie Oral History Program

results.title: The Koala. - Rev ed.
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Film Australia and John Shaw
results.brief_description: This film looks at the biological characteristics of the koala and the various types which are determined by its climatic region in Eastern Australia. Those features which make the koala peculiarly adaptable to its territorial environment are described and its life cycle is surveyed. A shorter, revised version of T/Code 005919.

results.title: The Koala, or 'native bear'
results.creator_credit: Lex Halliday and Australian Instructional Films
results.brief_description:
Episode number 1 of Series “Wild Life”.
Koala in Aboriginal = “no drink”. Koala in science = phascolarctos/pouched bear. Describes the stages in the early life of a koala, its characteristics, habitations, and comments on the pecularities of its diet.

results.title: The Koala quandry
results.creator_credit: Dione Gilmour, John Muirhead and ABC-TV (Australia)
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Animal passions”.
An examination of the feeding and habitat of the koala, the likely survival of the species in the face of environmental and biological threats is discussed.
